QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Lumbar MRI scan
QAPair.Answer: A lumbar magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan uses energy from strong magnets to create pictures of the lower part of the spine (lumbar spine). An MRI does not use radiation (x-rays). Single MRI images are called slices. The images can be stored on a computer or printed on film. One exam produces many images. Related exams include: Cervical MRI scan (neck MRI), MRI ,
